columns.text: In this exercise, we are to determine the sustainable growth rate of the company. We are also to determine the amount of new borrowing needed for the growth rate. Lastly, we are also to determine the growth rate assuming no outside financing is needed

## Sustainable Growth Rate

The sustainable growth rate is referred to as the maximum rate of growth attainable by the company without the need for external equity financing and at the same time, maintaining the debt-to-equity at a constant ratio.

The sustainable growth rate is the maximum rate of growth that a company would attain which requires the firm not to increase the company equity. While the ROE is the ratio of the net income and the equity.


Therefore, the sustainable growth rate is directly proportional to the ROE indicating that as the ROE increases, the sustainable growth rate increases and as the ROE decreases, the sustainable growth rate decreases as well.

Now, let us determine the sustainable growth rate of the company.

## Profit Margin

Profit margin is the ratio to which the company generates profit from its revenue.

Profit margin is considered as a determinant of growth since an increase in this ratio will consequently increase the company's ability to generate profit that is used to fund the internal operations of the firm, thus increasing the sustainable growth of the company.


The profit margin is computed as follows:
 
$$\text{Profit Margin}=\frac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Sales}}$$

## Total Asset Turnover

Investors may use this metric to see how well a company uses its resources to generate revenue.


An increase in the asset turnover ratio indicates an increase in the sales of the company. Consequently, this decreases the need for additional assets. Therefore, increasing asset turnover increases the sustainable growth rate of the company.

## Retention Ratio

The retention ratio is referred to as the rate of the net income that is included in the retained earnings and is used to grow the business.

Now, let us determine the amount of the retention ratio using the following given:

Now, let us compute the sustainable growth rate:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Sustainable Growth Rate}&=\frac{\text{ROE} \times b}{1-\text{ROE}\times b}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.2920\times 46\%}{1-0.2920\times 46\%}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1343}{1-0.1343}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1343}{0.8657}\times 100\\[12pt]
&={0.1551}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{15.51\%}\\

Where:
ROE= Return on Equity
*b*= Retention Ratio

## Internal Growth Rate

The internal growth rate is referred to as the initial maximum rate of growth attainable by a company without the need for external financing. It is the rate that the company could acquire with only internal financing.

## Accounting Return on Assets

Accounting Return on Assets is referred to as the financial measure of the company's profitability based on its assets. The ROA is computed by dividing the net income of the company by the total assets.

Now, let us compute the internal growth rate:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Internal Growth Rate}&=\frac{\text{ROA} \times b}{1-\text{ROA}\times b}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1272\times 46\%}{1-0.1272\times 46\%}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.0585}{1-0.0585}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.0585}{0.9415}\times 100\\[12pt]
&={0.0621}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{6.21\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$
Where:
ROA= Return on Assets
*b*= Retention Ratio
 
**The internal growth rate of the company is 6.21\%.**

The growth rate that could be supported by the company without the need for external financing is the internal growth rate or the maximum growth rate attainable by the company. 


Based on the computations in the preceding step, the internal growth rate of the company is 6.21\%.
The problem will require us to compute the sustainable growth rate and the amount that Molino Inc needs to borrow, assuming a constant debt-equity ratio.

### Let's first provide the given data in the problem.

|	Description	|	Amount	|
|--		|--:		|
|	Sales	|	$215,000.00 	|
|	Net Income	|	$17,300.00 	|
|	Dividends	|	$9,400.00 	|
|	Total Debt	|	$77,000.00 	|
|	Total Equity	|	$59,000.00 	|

## Requirement 1.

### Compute the sustainable growth rate.

### Define the sustainable growth rate.

The growth without external support and financing maintains a constant debt-equity ratio.

The sustainable growth rate is as follows,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sustainable Growth Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{ROE $\times$ b}}{\text{1 - ROE $\times$ b}}\\[15pt]
\end{aligned}
$$

Compute the return on equity.

The return on equity measures how the company's stockholders fared during the financial year.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Return on Equity}&= \dfrac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Total Equity}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\$17,300.00}{\$59,000.00}\\[15pt]

&= 0.2932 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{29.32\%}}


\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the return on equity is **29.32%**.

### Compute the amount of retained earnings.

The retained earnings are added to the equity section; this is calculated by deducting the declared dividends from the net income.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Net Income}&\$17,300.00\\
\text{Less: Declared Dividends}&\underline{9,400.00}\\
\textbf{Retained Earnings}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$7,900.00}}}

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the amount added to the retained earnings is **$7,900.00**.

### Compute the retention ratio.

The retention ratio measures the amount kept back in the business as retained earnings.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Retention Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Retained Earnings}}{\text{Net Income}}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{\$7,900.00}{\$17,300.00}\\[15pt]

&= 0.4566 \times 100\\[15pt]

&=\boxed{\textbf{45.66\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the retention ratio is **45.66%**.

### Compute the sustainable growth ratio.

The growth without external support and financing maintains a constant debt-equity ratio.

The sustainable growth rate is as follows,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sustainable Growth Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{ROE $\times$ b}}{\text{1 - ROE $\times$ b}}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{29.32\% \times45.66\%}{1- 29.32\% \times45.66\%}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{0.1339}{1- 0.1339}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{0.1339}{0.8661}\\[15pt]

&= 0.1546 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{15.46\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the sustainable growth rate is **15.46%**.

## Requirement 2.

### The amount of new borrowing that will take place next year, assuming the debt-equity ratio is constant.

### Compute the total assets.

The problem is silent to the total assets. The accounting equation is Assets = Liabilities +Owner's Equity. Thus, we will add total debt with total equity to compute the total assets.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Total Debt}&\$77,000.00\\
\text{Total Equity}&\underline{59,000.00}\\
\textbf{Total Assets}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$136,000.00}}}

\end{array}
$$


Therefore, the total assets are **$136,000.00**.

### Compute the debt ratio.

The problem states that we need to maintain a debt ratio.

The debt ratio is calculated by dividing total debt by total equity.


$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Debt Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Total Debt}}{\text{Total Assets}}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{\$77,000.00}{\$136,000.00}\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{0.57 times}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the debt ratio is **0.57 times**.

### Compute the new projected assets

Assets are always proportionate to the projected increase in sales. The sustainable growth rate is 15.46%. Therefore the asset should also increase by 15%. To compute the projected assets, we multiply assets by 1.1546
.
The projected assets are as follows.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Projected Asset}&= \text{Sustainable Growth Rate} \times \text{Current Asssets}\\[15pt]
&= 1.1546 \times \$136,000.00\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{\$157,025.60}}

\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the total projected assets are **$157,025.60**.

### Compute the additional borrowings.

The additional borrowings are calculated by deducting the current debt from the projected liability.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Projected Debt}&\$89,504.59\\
\text{Current Debt}&\underline{77,000.00}\\
\textbf{Additional Borrowings}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$12,504.59}}}

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the additional borrowings are **$12,504.59**.

## Requirement 3.


### Compute the internal growth rate with no external financing.

### Compute the return on assets.

The return on assets measures the profit for asset per dollar sale.

The formula and computation are as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Return on Assets}&= \dfrac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Total Assets}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\$17,300.00}{\$136,000.00}\\[15pt]

&= 0.1272 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{12.72\%}}


\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the return on assets is **12.72%**.

### Compute the internal growth rate.

**Internal Growth Rate** - It's one of the growth rates that a company can achieve without external support and financing.

The formula and calculation are as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Internal Growth Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{ROA $\times$ b}}{\text{1 - ROA $\times$ b}}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{12.72\% \times45.66\%}{1- 12.72\% \times45.66\%}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{0.0581}{1- 0.0581}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{0.0581}{0.9419}\\[15pt]

&= 0.0617 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{6.17\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the internal growth rate is **6.17%**.
